headline: Us Adds 850000 Jobs June Unemployment 59
summary: The U.S. economyadded 850,000 jobs in June, beating economists' predictions and improving on numbers fromAprilandMay. Leisure and hospitality industries led the growth with 343,000 jobs added. The unemployment rate rose from 5.8% to 5.9%; experts expected it to fall to 5.7%. On Thursday, the Labor Department reported that the number of people applying for unemployment benefits fell to 364,000 last week, the lowest level since the pandemic began.Most sources across the spectrum framed the report as a positive sign for the economy's post-pandemic recovery. Some coverage from left- and center-rated outlets also highlighted that the economy still has almost 7 million fewer jobs than it did before the pandemic.
